title: Drawing, "Six Octagonal Compostions, Hercules and Hebe, Two Foliated Ornaments, Sala di Ercole e Ebe, Palazzo Gessi", 1813
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on  laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Six octagons showing Hercules and Hebe: 1) Wedding of Hebe and Hercules; their right hands joined as they stand before Jupiter. 2) Hebe offers nectar to Jupiter and approaches seated gods. 3) Hebe offers nectar to Juno, seated at right, in front of goddesses. 4) Hebe shown falling, holding pitcher and cup. Gods seated in rear with Jupiter in center. On the bottom: 5) Hebe rejuvenates charioteer of Hercules. Hebe seated at left, holds bowl from which kneeling man drinks. Hercules with chariot.  6) Hebe offers nectar to Hercules. Mercurius leads her to Hercules. Two foliated ornaments of different designs, each consisting of center rosette and outer wreath connected by radially disposed plant motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Six Octagonal Compostions, Hercules and Hebe, Two Foliated Ornaments, Sala di Ercole e Ebe, Palazzo Gessi", 1813.
1813. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on  laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3480.
